link.synopsis: Breaking up is painful -- but does it have to be? Subdued individually by their relationship yet afraid of life apart, Zoe Lister Jones and Daryl Wein set out to meticulously orchestrate and manage their split into painlessness in this indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Me and You and Everyone We Know
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: After killing an innocent boy in London, hit men Ray (Colin Farrell, in a Golden Globe–winning role) and Ken (Brendan Gleeson) are ordered to lay low at a bed and breakfast in Bruges, Belgium, until their boss (Ralph Fiennes) phones with further instructions. But when he calls, Ken doesn't like the assignment. Written and directed by Martin McDonagh, this dark comedy earned a BAFTA for Best Original Screenplay.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels
Ghost Dog: The Way of the Samurai

link.synopsis: When he attends his younger brother's wedding, playboy Connor (Matthew McConaughey) is troubled to discover that the ghosts of his many girlfriends have come to give him a piece of their mind and teach him a thing or two about true love. As the apparitions visit him, he rediscovers old feelings for the first love of his life. Mark Waters directs this delightful romantic comedy also starring Jennifer Garner and Michael Douglas.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In writer-director Ron Shelton's action-comedy, two cops with ambitions beyond police work get sucked into the case of a lifetime. Det. Joe Gavilian (Harrison Ford) makes extra money in real estate, and his partner, K.C. Calden (Josh Hartnett), teaches yoga and dreams of acting. But when a rap group is killed onstage, the two must focus on solving the crime. The lead suspect is a controversial boss of a rap label whose head of security is also a cop.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Ambitious young record company intern Aaron Green (Jonah Hill) will let nothing get in the way of his planned rise to the top in the music business -- not even the unruly rock star (Russell Brand) he must escort to Los Angeles for the start of his anniversary concert. Doing whatever it takes to get the rocker from Point A to Point B, Aaron encounters all manners of mishaps in this comedy directed by Nicholas Stoller and produced by Judd Apatow.
link.title: synopsis
Russell Brand in New York City
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security
Crazy Richard & I Can't Even Think Straight
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
William S. Burroughs: A Man Within

link.synopsis: He was the class nerd before he made a fortune in the Internet boom of the 1990s. Now, Craig Dowd has invited his former classmates to his sprawling estate for a weekend reunion. The truth is that Craig's success went south years ago and his whole life is a facade. Of course, the reunion's guests have some secrets of their own.
link.title: synopsis
Forbidden Photos of a Lady Above Suspicion

link.synopsis: When the U.S. president and the U.K. prime minister decide to invade a certain Middle Eastern country, skeptical American and British operatives do their best to stop the runaway train to war in director Armando Iannucci's scathing political comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Page One: Inside the New York Times
Client 9: The Rise and Fall of Eliot Spitzer
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie

link.synopsis: When Johnny Johnson (Billy Dee Williams) learns that a job offer has been rescinded because he's black, he initiates a crusade against white America. Johnny and his followers take to the suburban streets to send a message that racism will no longer be tolerated. But the movement turns violent when the authorities confront the protesters, resulting in a climactic gun battle with police. D'Urville Martin and Celia Kaye co-star.
link.title: synopsis
In the Heat of the Night
The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman

link.synopsis: Having satisfied their urge for White Castle, Harold (John Cho) and Kumar (Kal Penn) jump on a plane to catch up with Harold's love interest (Paula Garcés), who's headed for the Netherlands. But the pair must change their plans when Kumar is accused of being a terrorist. Rob Corddry also stars in this wild comedy sequel that follows the hapless stoners' misadventures as they try to avoid being captured by the Department of Homeland Security.
link.title: synopsis
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Van Wilder 2: The Rise of Taj
Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

title.regular: Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
title.short: Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay

link.synopsis: This romantic comedy follows Rocket Singh, a salesman performing so well at work that he decides to start a company within the company he works for. In an effort to keep his venture under wraps, Singh adds con artist to his list of credentials.
link.title: synopsis

title.regular: Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
title.short: Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Three very different couples, all with unique relationship problems, plan a weekend getaway at Cummings Strawberry Farm, where the endgame is to indulge in an orgy that will hopefully lower everyone's inhibitions and strengthen their relationships. Naturally, the excursion's events don't go as smoothly as everyone hopes they will in this indie sex comedy from first-time director Andrew Drazek and writer-actor Ted Beck.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Naked Mile

link.synopsis: A harried film producer (Robert De Niro) juggles a lunatic director, a temperamental actor (Bruce Willis) and an out-of-control production while courting a studio head (Catherine Keener) and dealing with his ex (Robin Wright Penn) in director Barry Levinson's witty and poignant exploration of the movie business. The all-star comedy is based on veteran Hollywood producer Art Linson's sharply observed novel.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Vivica A. Fox heads the cast in this musical comedy centering on the struggles of young marrieds whose troubled union is closely connected to four spirits -- two good and two evil -- inhabiting the couple's house.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Diary of a Tired Black Man
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Breaking Up Is Hard to Do
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
R. Kelly Live! The Light It Up Tour

title.regular: Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs
title.short: Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs

link.synopsis: This sweet family comedy follows the adventures of four pint-sized detectives determined to find young Anna, who uses a helium balloon to send a note begging for help after she learns that her greedy stepmother is trying to steal her inheritance. The intrepid band of do-gooders uses their floating clubhouse as a base of operations while they employ their unique skills to the task of learning Anna's location and reuniting her with her grandmother.
link.title: synopsis
Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
The Mystical Adventures of Billy Owens
When Zachary Beaver Came to Town

link.synopsis: Colin Hanks stars in this offbeat comedy as a law student who quits school against his father's wishes to become the apprentice of cantankerous illusionist the Great Buck Howard (John Malkovich). Looking to regain the magic of his once-successful career, Howard takes his show on the road, where he and his new assistant endure a series of hilarious misadventures. Hanks's real-life dad, two-time Oscar winner Tom Hanks, co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
How to Be a Serial Killer
The Year of Getting to Know Us

link.synopsis: When her husband, Chester (Luke Perry), depletes their savings account to finance his pie-in-the-sky dreams of becoming an inventor, Etta (Elaine Hendrix) hits on a plan to raise cash for her sons' college fund: robbing her husband's liquor store. But before long, Etta finds herself neck-deep in blackmail, strippers and a whole lot of trouble. Jim Issa directs this Southern-fried comedy that also stars country singer LeAnn Rimes.
link.title: synopsis
Shoot First and Pray You Live
Larry the Cable Guy: Tailgate Party
How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: This collection compiles vintage Superman short films that played in theaters in the early 1940s. Fully restored, the cartoons from the legendary Fleischer Studios feature crisp graphics that blend styles including Art Deco and German Expressionism.
link.title: synopsis
Cartoons That Time Forgot: UB Iwerks Collection: Vol. 1
Cartoons That Time Forgot: Van Beuren Studios
He-Man and the Masters of the Universe (1983)
The Super Mario Bros. Super Show!
Cartoons That Time Forgot: UB Iwerks Collection: Vol. 2
Pink Panther Cartoon Collection: The Ant and the Aardvark
Power Rangers Samurai: Christmas Together, Friends Forever (Christmas Special)

link.synopsis: When budget cuts in Bayside compel the small town to cut one of its two ambulance companies, the rivals battle it out as each tries to be the chosen unit in this raucous anything-goes romp jam-packed with physical comedy and frat-house humor. The oddball paramedics from the Bayside Ambulatory Life Services (B.A.L.S.) squad and the Downtown Intensive Care (D.I.C.) team go to increasingly outrageous lengths to outsmart and outmaneuver each other.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When his pure genius goes ignored and a brainless jock tempts his dream girl (Sophia Myles), ambitious art school student Jerome Platz (Max Minghella) sets in motion a brazen plan to become an art world hero and win his beloved's heart. John Malkovich, Jim Broadbent, Matt Keeslar, Anjelica Huston and Ethan Suplee co-star in Terry Zwigoff's dark comedy about an overachiever who goes to extremes to get the girl.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
Art 21: Art in the Twenty-First Century
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Me and You and Everyone We Know
How to Get Ahead in Advertising
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Though she's not ready to begin dating, beautiful widow Celia Amonte (Sofia Milos) finds herself drawn into a relationship with charming Brit Charlie Beck (Jason Isaacs) ... who's harboring a big secret in this savory romantic comedy. It seems the smitten Charlie -- a nomadic professional gambler passing himself off as a tycoon -- has agreed to teach Celia's daughter (Emmy Rossum) the tricks of the trade in return for help wooing her mother.
link.title: synopsis
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: As soon as she learns about her niece Shirley's health issues, super-grandma and problem-solver Madea takes over the situation one more time, summoning together her highly fragmented clan in this madcap dramatic comedy all about family values.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Tyler Perry: What's Done in the Dark
I Can Do Bad All By Myself
Diary of a Mad Black Woman
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart

title.regular: Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
title.short: Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family

link.synopsis: One installment of the wildly popular "Colgate Comedy Hour," featuring unstoppable twosome Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis, is included here. Building on the momentum of the red-hot variety television show craze of the 1950s, Martin & Lewis welcomed guests such as Dick Humphreys, Gretchen Houser and musical group The Treniers. Also featured are theatrical trailers from some celebrated Martin & Lewis films.
link.title: synopsis
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 3: Still Laughing
Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis: Vol. 2: When Television Was Funny
My Friend Irma / My Friend Irma Goes West
The George Burns & Gracie Allen Show
Sid Caesar Collection: The Buried Treasures
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!
The Very Best of the Honeymooners
The Jack Benny Show: Collector's Edition
The Golden Age of TV Comedy
The Golden Age of TV Drama
Henry IV / The Story of Mag Mallory
None But My Foe / Trial of Peter Zenger

title.regular: Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour VII / At the Movies with Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis
title.short: Martin & Lewis: Colgate Comedy Hour VII

link.synopsis: California surfer Robbie (Randy Wayne) has a summer he never expected in this wild comedy when he and his mother (Lindsay Wagner) relocate to Colorado and he lands a job at the local water park. Robbie soon settles in, wooing lifeguard cutie Katie and the park owner's sexy daughter, Tiffany. But trouble surfaces when Robbie competes for the Surfer King crown and learns that the spoiled Tiffany is plotting against him. Alan Thicke co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
The Bruce Brown Surf Collection: Surfing Hollow Days
I Love You, I Love You Not
God Went Surfing with the Devil

link.synopsis: With the U.S. President mortally ill, Vice President Mackenzie Allen (Geena Davis) is poised to become the first female president in the nation's history. Conniving Speaker of the House Nathan Templeton (Donald Sutherland), however, has other plans. Once in office, President Allen's challenges only deepen, as does Templeton's treachery. This well-produced political drama series earned Geena Davis an Emmy nomination for her pioneering role.
link.title: synopsis
Commander in Chief: The Complete Series
National Geographic: Inside the White House
National Geographic: Ambassador: Inside the Embassy
Leona Helmsley: The Queen of Mean
Landslide: A Portrait of President Herbert Hoover
National Geographic: Inside the U.S. Secret Service

link.synopsis: While gathering evidence against his institutional employer to help the FBI build a price-fixing conspiracy case, affable agribusiness executive Mark Whitacre (Matt Damon) begins to piece together a fantasy world of his own. Scott Bakula, Joel McHale and Melanie Lynskey co-star in Steven Soderbergh's dark comedy, which is based on Kurt Eichenwald's acclaimed nonfiction book about the true-life Corporate America whistle-blower.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Men Who Stare at Goats
Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans
Justice League: Crisis on Two Earths
The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest
The Girl Who Played with Fire
The Most Dangerous Man in America: Daniel Ellsberg and the Pentagon Papers
Manufacturing Consent: Noam Chomsky and the Media
Julian Assange: A Modern Day Hero? Inside the World of WikiLeaks
Casino Jack and the United States of Money

link.synopsis: In 1972, the Taft High School football team challenged its archrival in a game to end all games -- and might have won if Jack "Butterfingers" Dundee (Robin Williams) hadn't dropped the ball. Still haunted years later, Jack cooks up a rematch to settle old scores. His old friend and quarterback (Kurt Russell) agrees to go along with the harebrained plan, but winning will be an uphill battle. Roger Spottiswoode directs this sports comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
Take This Job and Shove It
How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: Stephen Turnbull (Edward Hogg) hasn't left his flat in months. With so much time to think, his mind wanders back to a road trip he and his friend Bunny (Simon Farnaby) once took across Europe. As he revisits the journey, a psychedelic swirl of memories invades his living room. And since most of the trip was an utter disaster, Stephen's apartment is in for a makeover. Paul King, the mad genius behind "The Mighty Boosh," helms this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
A Film with Me in It
Me and You and Everyone We Know
The Increasingly Poor Decisions of Todd Margaret
How to Get Ahead in Advertising
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: Playing to sold-out venues across America, the Allah Made Me Funny tour bridges cultural gaps through stand-up by some of the funniest Muslim comics working today. This performance program captures the groundbreaking tour's best moments. Featured comedians include event co-founder and "Saturday Night Live" writer Preacher Moss, Kuwait-to-Texas transplant Mohammed Amer, and Moss's creative partner, Chicagoan Azhar Usman.
link.title: synopsis
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 3
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Jason Stuart: Making It to the Middle
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Suzanne Westenhoefer: A Bottom on Top
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Tess: Looking for My Next Ex-Husband
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show

title.regular: Allah Made Me Funny: The Official Muslim Comedy Tour: Live in Concert

link.synopsis: Take an in-depth look at the personal lives and careers of the famous Marx Brothers: Groucho, Harpo, Chico, Zeppo and Gummo. Pioneers on the American comedy scene, the brothers' comedic timing, wit and style are unmatched to this day. Fans will delight in this broad collection of Marx memorabilia, including favorites such as "Animal Crackers," "Monkey Business," "Duck Soup" and "A Night at the Opera," as well as interviews and rare footage.
link.title: synopsis
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
Ken Burns' America: Empire of the Air
Starz Inside: The Face Is Familiar
The Kellogg Brothers: Corn Flake Kings
The Last Mogul: The Life and Times of Lew Wasserman
Betty Boop: The Queen of Cartoons
Harlan Ellison: Dreams with Sharp Teeth
Modern Marvels: Television: Window to the World
A Walk into the Sea: Danny Williams and the Warhol Factory
Landslide: A Portrait of President Herbert Hoover
Tony Bennett: The Music Never Ends
Merrily We Roll Along: The Early Days of the Automobile

title.regular: Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
title.short: Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers

link.synopsis: Starring Tony Roberts and Donald "Speedy" Caldwell Jr., this comedy centers on a loving son who breaks the rules to help his mom. With one more day of parole left, J.T. vows to play by the book. But when he finds out his mom will lose their home unless they come up with a serious amount of money, J.T. takes a chance. He enters a low rider car contest and violates the conditions of his parole. Will he get away with it?
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me

link.synopsis: Middle school isn't all it's cracked up to be for self-described "wimpy kid" Greg Heffley, who discovers a frightening new world teeming with boys who are taller, tougher and hairier than he is -- and decides to document it all in his diary. Directed by Thor Freudenthal, this kid-friendly comedy based on Jeff Kinney's illustrated novel cast its star by asking kids to submit their auditions online.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
Judy Moody and the Not Bummer Summer
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel
Hannah Montana: One in a Million
Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief
All Grown Up!: R.V. Having Fun Yet?
All Grown Up!: Growing Up Changes Everything
All Grown Up!: All Grown Up ... and Loving It!
As Told by Ginger: Far from Home

link.synopsis: Stuck in a vicious cycle of dead-end relationships with two-timing men, Los Angeles resident Amanda (Cameron Diaz) and Londoner Iris (Kate Winslet) decide to swap homes. In the process, their trade paves the way for romances they never imagined possible. This charming comedy from writer-director Nancy Meyers features an all-star cast that includes Jude Law, Jack Black, Edward Burns and Rufus Sewell.
link.title: synopsis
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Love and Death on Long Island

link.synopsis: Facing an unplanned pregnancy while she's still in high school, quirky teen Juno MacGuff (Ellen Page) devises a plan to locate her unborn baby's perfect adoptive parents. But the seemingly ideal couple (Jason Bateman and Jennifer Garner) Juno chooses still has some growing up to do. Michael Cera co-stars in this offbeat coming-of-age comedy with an Oscar-winning original screenplay penned by Diablo Cody.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.synopsis: Milo Boyd (Gerard Butler) is a bounty hunter whose latest gig is rather satisfying, as he finds out that the bail-skipper he must chase down is his own ex-wife, Nicole (Jennifer Aniston) -- but she has no intention of getting nabbed without a fight. Complicating matters, Nicole's wannabe-boyfriend, Stewart (Jason Sudeikis), joins the chase in this high-octane comedy from director Andy Tennant (Hitch).
link.title: synopsis
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
He's Just Not That Into You
Tomb Raider: The Cradle of Life

link.synopsis: Jack Lemmon and Walter Matthau play battling newspapermen in 1920s Chicago in this fast-paced version of the comedy classic from director Billy Wilder. Lemmon is ace reporter Hildy Johnson and Matthau his irascible editor, Walter Burns. Hildy wants to quit and marry Peggy Grant (Susan Sarandon), but Walter will do anything to stop him, and an escaped killer (Austin Pendleton) gives him just the scoop he needs to lure Hildy back to work.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
The Last Time I Saw Archie

link.synopsis: In an effort to impress his beloved, college-bound dream girl Cinny (Maia Campbell), daydreaming high school senior Gregory "G" Reed (Deon Richmond) starts applying to colleges, a move that his parents like but his pals Fish (Guy Torry) and June (Donald Faison) gleefully mock. As the prom nears, G must leave his fantasy world and step up his game to compete with Cinny's stuck-up boyfriend in this high-spirited high school comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Why Do Fools Fall in Love
Just Another Girl on the I.R.T.
R. Kelly Live! The Light It Up Tour

link.synopsis: When he starts dating drop-dead gorgeous Molly, insecure airport security agent Kirk can't believe it. As his friends and family share their doubts about the relationship lasting, Kirk does everything he can to avoid losing Molly forever. Kyrsten Ritter, Lindsay Sloane, Jasika Nicole and Andrew Daly also star in this charming romantic comedy about unlikely lovers. Jim Field Smith directs.
link.title: synopsis
Aqua Teen Hunger Force Colon Movie Film for Theaters
I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell
Sex and the City: The Movie
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!

link.synopsis: After coming across letters from his estranged older sister Daliya (Tinkerbell), teenager Ilan (Adam Hirsch) runs away to search for her. Finding her in Haifa, he settles in with Daliya and soon develops an unhealthy attraction to her. Meanwhile, Ilan becomes intrigued by the fascinating adventures of Daliya's neighbor, a Russian activist (Assi Dayan). This poignant coming-of-age tale garnered eight Israeli Academy Award nominations and one win.
link.title: synopsis
Angelique: The Road to Versailles / Angelique and the King
Return from India: A Story of Forbidden Love
Turn Left at the End of the World

link.synopsis: When a strange cosmic event turns the citizens of Los Angeles into blood-drinking, flesh-eating, sex-starved zombies, a handful of cops and gang members form an unlikely alliance to fend off the insatiable undead. Soon the motley crew must make their way to a compound up the coast, where a scientist and his sexy daughter may hold the key to survival. C. Thomas Howell stars in this indie horror-comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Masters of Horror: Joe Dante: Homecoming
Death Valley: The Revenge of Bloody Bill
Bachelor Party in the Bungalow of the Damned
Masters of Horror: Tobe Hooper: Dance of the Dead

link.synopsis: Tim Conway plays Vernon Praiseworthy, a dimwit who inherits a fortune from former hobo Choo Choo Trayne (Will Geer). In order to collect the legacy, Vernon must emulate Choo Choo by going "on the bum." It's a sight-gag tour de force for comedy veteran Conway, who's best remembered as a hilarious second banana on the "Carol Burnett Show" and as the bumbling "Dorf" in a series of mock how-to movies.
link.title: synopsis
The Shakiest Gun in the West
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird
Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega

link.synopsis: Narrated by legendary drag diva RuPaul, this entertaining special explores the history of cinematic cross-dressing, from Tony Curtis and Jack Lemmon in the comedy classic Some Like It Hot to John Travolta's take on Edna Turnblad in Hairspray. Other gender-bending films examined include Mrs. Doubtfire, The Rocky Horror Picture Show, Tootsie, Ed Wood, Psycho, White Chicks, Big Momma's House and more.
link.title: synopsis
Starz Inside: The Face Is Familiar
Gendernauts: A Journey Through Shifting Identities
Follow My Voice: With the Music of Hedwig
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Going to Pieces: The Rise and Fall of the Slasher Film
Starz Inside: Sex and the Cinema
A Wink and a Smile: The Art of Burlesque
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement
Betty Boop: The Queen of Cartoons
Nightmares in Red, White and Blue
Trained in the Ways of Men
Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
For the Bible Tells Me So
Frontline: The Dancing Boys of Afghanistan
Kimora: Life in the Fab Lane
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
This Film Is Not Yet Rated
Harlan Ellison: Dreams with Sharp Teeth
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
Starz Inside: Anime: Drawing A Revolution

link.synopsis: Tired of dealing with the homophobic school bully, out-of-the-closet teen Chance Marquis (Tad Hilgenbrinck) enlists two disparate friends -- a flashy drag queen and the hunky school jock -- to help him crush his tormentor in this offbeat comedy set in the 1980s. A favorite on the festival circuit, this quirky film co-stars Brett Chukerman, Aldevina Da Silva, Pieter Van Nieuwenhuyze and Chris Mulkey.
link.title: synopsis
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
Surge of Power: The Stuff of Heroes

link.synopsis: New couple Erin (Drew Barrymore) and Garrett (Justin Long) don't want their summer fling to end, but Erin must move across the country to finish school. As the bicoastal lovers try to keep their relationship going, they experience the tricky challenges of living long-distance. Directed by established documentary filmmaker Nanette Burstein (The Kid Stays in the Picture), this romantic comedy also stars Christina Applegate and Ron Livingston.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and the City: The Movie
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
Romy and Michele's High School Reunion

link.synopsis: Though he has no athletic ability whatsoever, college student Calvin Marshall (Alex Frost) is so blindly single-minded about making the school baseball team that Coach Little (Steve Zahn) -- a former minor league player -- relents and lets him on the squad. But when he's sidelined by an injury, Calvin has an opportunity to discover his true talent in life. Gary Lundgren directs this charming comedy that co-stars Michelle Lombardo.
link.title: synopsis
Jews and Baseball: An American Love Story

link.synopsis: Mild-mannered typesetter Luther Heggs (Don Knotts) wants to be a respectable reporter, so he decides to get the scoop on local ghosts by spending a fated night at a haunted abode where there's been an unsolved murder. When the community thinks he's concocting a fable, he's determined to convince them of what he's witnessed. Will his sensational story make him a bona fide journalist? Liam Redmond and Joan Staley co-star in this classic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Shakiest Gun in the West
Journey to the Center of the Earth

link.synopsis: The popular sci-fi comedy series serves up yet another futuristic classic. This one's a campy adventure starring Leslie McRae as Michele Casey, a dancer at the Go-Go Revue who's torn between two lovers. Will she choose the driven but dastardly Buz Nichols (Tom Pace), or the warmhearted-but-too-innocent Finley "Critter" Jones (Jody Daniels)? And can Michele succeed in steering clear of drugs and the dangers permeating her world?
link.title: synopsis
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Blood Waters of Dr. Z
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Rebel Set
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Night of the Blood Beast
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Monster a Go-Go
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Beginning of the End
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Secret Agent, Super Dragon
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Warrior of the Lost World
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Giant Gila Monster
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Crawling Eye
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Corpse Vanishes
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Red Zone Cuba
Mystery Science Theater 3000: I Accuse My Parents
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Touch of Satan
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Incredibly Strange Creatures Who Stopped Living and Became Mixed-Up Zombies
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Guiron
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Manhunt in Space
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Atomic Brain
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Zigra
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Gaos
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Gamera vs. Barugon

title.regular: Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Girl in Gold Boots
title.short: MST3K: The Girl in Gold Boots

link.synopsis: Inspired by the experiences of one of its stars -- Channing Tatum -- this Steven Soderberg-helmed comedy focuses on the world of male strippers. Tatum plays a veteran stripper introducing a new dancer to the pleasures and perils of their profession.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days

link.synopsis: In this sexy indie comedy from actress-turned-writer/director Katie Aselton, a young couple in a bit of a relationship slump make a pact that they're each allowed to have a one-night stand with another person, no questions asked. Naturally, this kind of thing always sounds easier and a lot more fun than it actually is, as they both soon discover. Ever-reliable comic actor Dax Shepard plays the male half of the equation.
link.title: synopsis
Hugh Hefner: Playboy, Activist and Rebel

link.synopsis: Hollywood comedy director Tom Shadyac (Ace Ventura: Pet Detective) gets contemplative in this documentary, which finds him conversing with prominent philosophers and spiritual leaders about what ails our world and how we can improve it. Traveling the globe to conduct his in-depth interviews, Shadyac finds insights and inspiration from Archbishop Desmond Tutu, historian Howard Zinn, philosopher Noam Chomsky and other luminaries.
link.title: synopsis
Power of the Past with Bill Moyers: Florence
The Flowering of Human Consciousness: Eckhart Tolle
A Path to Happiness: His Holiness the Dalai Lama
King: Man of Peace in a Time of War
Out of Place: Memories of Edward Said
A Wayfarer's Journey: Listening to Mahler
Che Guevara: Where You'd Never Imagine Him

link.synopsis: Perhaps best known for his trademark rants on "The Daily Show," comedian Lewis Black has become one of America's most unique stand-up comedians. This documentary charts his progression from theater buff to blistering satirist. After earning a degree at the University of North Carolina, Black authored hundreds of plays. But he found his calling while acting as master of ceremonies at his stage productions, leading to him taking a stab at comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Steven Wright: When the Leaves Blow Away
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Sam Kinison: Why Did We Laugh?
Mr. Warmth: The Don Rickles Project
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
The Comedians of Comedy: The Movie
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour
Bob & Tom Radio: The Comedy Tour
Bill Hicks Live: Satirist, Social Critic, Stand-up Comedian
John Oliver's New York Stand-Up Show
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
Bobby Slayton: Born to Be Bobby
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York

title.regular: Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story
title.short: Basic Black: The Lewis Black Story

link.synopsis: Frank Sinatra stars as playboy Alan Baker in Norman Lear's adaptation of Neil Simon's play. Alan enjoys a steady stream of women in his Manhattan apartment -- something his brother, Buddy (Tony Bill), hopes to share in when he moves in. But Buddy emulates big bro a little too well, leading Alan to question his own lifetstyle. Soon, he's looking to guide Buddy down a better path, while settling down with one of his lady friends (Barbara Rush).
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Frank Sinatra Show with Ella Fitzgerald
The Man with the Golden Arm: 50th Anniversary Special Edition
Tony Bennett: The Music Never Ends
There's No Business Like Show Business
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: Spiced liberally with black comedy, this Bollywood drama from director Vishal Bhardwaj follows the lethal love life of Susanna Anna-Marie Johannes, who marries numerous men -- only to find them flawed. The solution? Death.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Uli Edel directs this Best Foreign Language Film Oscar nominee charting the birth of West Germany's Red Army Faction, a radical left-wing terrorist group formed in the late 1960s amid a climate of revolution and a fallen generation. Staging a series of bombings, kidnappings and assassinations, the RAF waged a war against fascism with a direct assault against the powers of American imperialism and the fledgling German democracy.
link.title: synopsis
Harlan: In the Shadow of Jew Süss
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death

link.synopsis: Nerdy teacher Ronald Gibb (Tim Daly) has trouble hiding his tiny crush on gorgeous student Ally (Hayden Panettiere), which all starts to look very bad for Ronald once Ally is kidnapped and he's the last person to be seen with her. As Ronald becomes the main suspect, the suburban community turns upside down in this dark comedy, also starring William Sadler as Ally's entrepreneurial father and Sarah Steele as the spunky Amber Jinxs.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: On the lam in 1962 for a crime he thinks he committed, family guy Willie Husband (Brian Wimmer) flees his picture-perfect Santa Fe wife, Joy (Marcia Gay Harden), and child, lands in a cryogenic deep sleep with dim bulb buddy Frank (Peter Berg), and wakes up 29 years later yet only one day older. In this sci-fi romantic comedy, Willie tries to go home again, but discovers on arrival that even if his feelings haven't changed, Joy's life has.
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Fell to Earth
Timerider: The Adventure of Lyle Swann
The Dark Side of the Moon

link.synopsis: Paul Reiser, Matthew Modine and Randy Quaid star as three divorced dads struggling to adapt to single life as they manage their relationships with their ex-wives, kids and new romantic prospects in this comedy-drama. Donny (Reiser) tries to communicate with his teenage daughter (Eliza Dushku), Dave (Modine) juggles too many women and Vic (Quaid) suffers through a disastrous date with a neurotic woman (Janeane Garofalo).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: From comedy icon Buster Keaton comes this masterwork about a hapless projectionist whose sweetheart is pursued by an unscrupulous rival. After being falsely accused of theft, Buster dreams himself into an exciting detective movie and cracks the case.
link.title: synopsis
Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon

link.synopsis: Simon and Pam's marriage is hitting the boredom phase when Simon falls for a beautiful musician going through her own marital woes. This quartet is about to find out more than they want to know about life in this smart comedy.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
He's Just Not That Into You
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?

link.synopsis: Silver-screen icon James Stewart plays baseball star Robert "Dutch" Holland, a third baseman for the St. Louis Cardinals who's forced to trade the glamour of big-time sports for the anonymous and dangerous existence of a World War II bomber pilot. Dutch's wife, Sally (June Allyson), stands steadfastly by her husband, a former Air Force lieutenant colonel, as he's recalled to duty in the middle of a brilliantly successful baseball career.
link.title: synopsis
Crusade in the Pacific: America at War
The Great Ships: The Aircraft Carriers

link.synopsis: Roomies Royce (Ben Watkins) and Damien (Laz Alonso) -- who are polar opposites -- find their lives turned topsy-turvy by the arrival of pretty new housemate Toni (Shawna Rodgers) in this slice-of-life urban comedy. Will she be the glue that holds the trio together, or will Toni drive a wedge between straight-arrow accountant Royce and tomcat real estate broker Damien? The cast also includes Todd Bridges, Mailon Rivera and Barri Whittaker.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Love and Other Four Letter Words
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Diary of a Tired Black Man
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Five on the Black Hand Side
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me
Breaking Up Is Hard to Do

link.synopsis: Danny (Paul Rudd) and Wheeler (Seann William Scott) have coasted their way through jobs at an energy drink company. But when their goofing off catches up with them, they're sentenced to community service with the Sturdy Wings mentoring program. The assignment is supposed to teach them responsibility, but it just proves that they're the last people who should be taking care of kids. Elizabeth Banks co-stars in David Wain's sidesplitting comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star

link.synopsis: Nick Snowden (Thomas Cavanagh) is next in line to take over the duties of Santa Claus. When the bumbling trainee loses his prized reindeer three days before Christmas, he undertakes a journey from the North Pole to California to bring it back. There, he falls for a friendly zookeeper (Ashley Williams), runs afoul of a mean-spirited hunter (Patrick Fabian) and struggles to conceal his true identity in this family-friendly comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Golden Christmas 2: The Second Tail
For the Love of a Dog

link.synopsis: In this madcap musical comedy of errors, two bumbling fishermen rescue small-time hustler Jeetu from drowning. Mistaking him for a millionaire, they hatch a scheme to use him to pay off their debts -- and before long everything goes haywire.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Writer, director and actor Yvan Attal trains his lens on the vicissitudes of love, marriage and monogamy in this crisp romantic comedy. Married with children, Vincent (Attal) is cheating on his wife, Gabrielle (Charlotte Gainsbourg), who's having thoughts of infidelity herself. Meanwhile, Georges (Alain Chabat) dreams of release from his constrictive marriage, and bachelor playboy Fred (Alain Cohen) longs for a committed relationship.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: Mary (Parker Posey), a flighty, unemployed, 24-year-old Manhattanite, is trying to get her life in order. But instead of bothering herself with a real job, she throws a series of parties at her apartment to pay the rent. When she gets thrown in jail after one of her soirees is raided, she has to take a library job to repay her godmother, who bailed her out of the clink. Daisy Von Scherler Mayer directs this definitive "Generation X" comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this love-crazed comedy, commitment-phobic lesbian Allegra (Elizabeth Reaser) is recovering from a breakup with her girlfriend when she starts to fall for a member of the opposite sex -- and now she's questioning her sexuality and her sanity. Philip (Justin Kirk) is the tidy professor who's romancing the ambivalent Allegra while she pursues Grace (Gretchen Mol), a straight woman who's recently become single.
link.title: synopsis
The Ultimate Lesbian Short Film Festival
Edie & Thea: A Very Long Engagement
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: This Military Channel documentary series takes an inside look at the tools used by the U.S. military in modern warfare, from aircraft that took 18 years to develop to equipment created in backyards and garages.
link.title: synopsis
Secrets of War: Spy Games of World War II
Crusade in the Pacific: America at War
Ground War: The Evolution of the Battlefield
Empires of Industry: War Planes of World War II
National Geographic: Inside American Power: The Pentagon
National Geographic: Inside Shock and Awe
Return to Tarawa: The Leon Cooper Story
National Geographic: Pearl Harbor: Legacy of Attack
The Bombing of Germany: American Experience
National Geographic: The Battle for Midway
In Search of History: Navajo Code Talkers
Battlefield Detectives: Native American Wars: The Apache
The New Explorers: Betrayal at Little Big Horn

link.synopsis: On the idyllic Greek isle of Kalokairi, single mom Donna Sheridan (Meryl Streep) goes into a tizzy when her bride-to-be daughter (Amanda Seyfried), in a bid to learn her father's identity, invites three of Donna's ex-lovers to the wedding. Buoyed by the tunes of ABBA, this effervescent yarn -- a Golden Globe nominee for Best Picture (Comedy or Musical) -- also stars Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth and Stellan Skarsgård as the trio of potential dads.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Phantom of the Opera: Special Edition
I Don't Know How She Does It
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: 40-Year-Old Virgin collaborators Judd Apatow and Seth Rogen re-team for this partially autobiographical high school comedy starring Jonah Hill and Michael Cera as best buddies facing separation anxiety as they prepare to go off to college. While attempting to score alcohol for a party with help from their fake ID-toting friend, "McLovin" (Christopher Mintz-Plasse), the guys' evening takes a turn into chaotic territory.
link.title: synopsis
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: Roland Young returns as Cosmo Topper in the third and final film (following 1937's Topper and 1939's Topper Takes a Trip) in the highly popular comedy series. This time around, Joan Blondell is the ghost, and Topper helps her rest in peace by finding her murderer. An added attraction here is the inimitable Eddie Anderson, better known as "Rochester."
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
Sherlock Holmes: The Woman in Green

link.synopsis: In this offbeat, convoluted comedy of errors, college student Caleb (Scott Lunsford) has the hots for Gwen (Emily Stiles), who seems to relate better to gay men than to their straight counterparts. Hoping to help his pal attract Gwen's attention, Caleb's gay roommate, Kyle (Jim Verraros), persuades his friend to pretend he's gay. But the plan rapidly unravels when Marc, Gwen's gay roommate and Kyle's secret love, falls for the imposter.
link.title: synopsis
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
The Best of Boys in Love

link.synopsis: The Secret Service enlists flatfoot Kum Lhau (Petchtai Wongkamlao) to infiltrate a Thai record label, where he's tasked with investigating covert weapons dealings while masquerading as a pop singer -- but before long, he becomes the country's biggest music star. Meanwhile, he discovers that a co-worker (Jacqueline Apitananon) is a CIA operative assigned to the same mission in this fast-paced action comedy also starring Janet Khiew.
link.title: synopsis
Beats of the Heart: Two Faces of Thailand: A Musical Portrait
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power

link.synopsis: A Parisian dinner party sets the stage for this comedy of manners about a group of acquaintances and their dysfunctional romantic relationships. As the guest list grows, a simple outing unravels into chaos. The attendees include married hostess Marie-Laurence, who learns that her ex-lover will be attending; Mélanie and her husband, Alain, who are on the brink of divorce; and Marie-Laurence's estranged father, who makes a surprise appearance.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Raunchy teen comedy meets the Black Plague in David Leland's take on literary classic The Decameron. Hayden Christensen stars as 14th-century lothario Lorenzo, who falls for the beautiful Pampinea (Mischa Barton) as they escape to the Italian countryside. But Lorenzo's got competition from the evil Gerbino (Tim Roth) and the obsessed Count Dzerzhinsky (Matthew Rhys), both of whom want to claim the chaste maiden as their own.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Sophia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni team up for a trio of stories about sex in this Oscar-winning Italian comedy. In the first vignette, Loren plays a woman who avoids jail time by pumping out babies with a willing accomplice; in the second, the duo plays a pair of clandestine lovers who are forced to work out their problems in a car; and finally, Loren is a prostitute who quits her best john for a man of the cloth.
link.title: synopsis
The Night of the Shooting Stars

link.synopsis: The KGB just wants to have fun in this Cold War-era comedy starring John Travolta as Travis and Arye Gross as Wendell, two hipper-than-thou guys who are kidnapped by the Soviets on their way to the opening of a nightclub. The men and their mullets are then put into service by the KGB, which seeks a cultural advantage by understanding American wisecracks. Travolta's future wife, Kelly Preston, also stars, sharing witty banter and the dance floor.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: When minor-league hockey player Derek Thompson -- who has a penchant for knocking out his opponents' teeth every time he plays -- disillusions a fan, he is sentenced to a stint for one week as a bona fide, tutu-clad, real-life tooth fairy. Soon, Derek is inspired to rekindle his youthful dreams. Ashley Judd portrays his love interest, Carly, in this family comedy starring The Rock aka Dwayne Johnson.
link.title: synopsis
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel
Percy Jackson & the Olympians: The Lightning Thief
Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie

link.synopsis: Larry and Lauren Barnabee (Maurice Weiss and Susie Duff) don't want their son, Darren (Arthur Gadsby), to be gay -- so much so that they hire a girl to "turn" him straight. But what they don't know is that Darren's playing the gay card to &NFi;get&NFi_; girls, not push them away. Porn star Ron Jeremy co-stars as himself in this independent coming-of-age comedy from writer-director team Seth Gimlan and Gurtej Singh.
link.title: synopsis
The Gay Bed & Breakfast of Terror

link.synopsis: From director Rob Reiner comes a multigenerational family saga about the highs and lows of love. Bryce and Juli first meet as second graders, with Juli having a crush on the uncertain Bryce, and as they mature, it appears their love may blossom. As they wrestle with the problems of adolescence, their parents cope with an assortment of issues of their own. Aidan Quinn, Rebecca De Mornay and Anthony Edwards co-star in this poignant romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Romance of Astrea and Celadon
I Love You, I Love You Not

link.synopsis: Thirtysomething Duncan (Brendan Patricks) takes a trip down memory lane, examining the highs and lows of his most recent relationships with women. Along the way, he picks up interesting advice and learns important lessons about love in the modern world. Based on the novel On Love by Alain de Botton, this romantic comedy co-stars Naomie Harris, Kelly Adams, Cécile Cassel, Edith Bukovics and Jane March.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Famous couple Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton team up in this drama based on Graham Greene's novel. During the era of Papa Doc Duvalier's despotic rule of Haiti, hotel owner Brown (Burton) watches as both his adopted country and his inn start crumbling. To drown his worries, he throws himself into a passionate affair with the wife (Taylor) of a South American diplomat (Peter Ustinov). Alec Guinness, Lillian Gish and James Earl Jones co-star.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: The Heart Is a Lonely Hunter
One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
The Fall of the Roman Empire: Deluxe Edition
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
A Guide for the Married Man

link.synopsis: Strip club promoter Jimmy (Heath Ledger) lands in dangerous waters after botching a routine job for a gangster in this Aussie crime thriller tinged with inky comedy. Things go awry when street kids rip off the $10,000 Jimmy is supposed to deliver for stony mobster Pando (Bryan Brown). Desperate to recoup the loot, Jimmy finds himself involved in a bank heist scheme -- and with an ethereal country lass (Rose Byrne) who exhorts him to go straight.
link.title: synopsis
All the Way: The Kidnapping of a Music Legend
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
A Film with Me in It

link.synopsis: Filmmaker Caveh Zahedi uses an unconventional mix of home movies, candid confessionals and reenactments to chronicle his own struggles with sex addiction in this award-winning autobiographical comedy. Zahedi's story begins on the night of his third marriage, an event that triggers self-examination into how his obsession with prostitutes and unabashed honesty resulted in failed relationships. Zahedi, Rebecca Lord and Emily Morse star.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Some Folks Call It a Sling Blade

link.synopsis: Brash Cliff Starkey (Paul Kaye) dreams of playing for England in the lawn-bowls championship against rival Australia, but the traditionalists in the community bowls club -- namely Ray Speight (James Cromwell) -- despise Cliff's showmanship. When slick American sports agent Rick Schwartz (Vince Vaughn) takes Cliff under his wing, his antics, attitude and natural ability turn him into a national icon in director Mel Smith's offbeat British comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This madcap comedy charts the rapid downhill spiral of Bill Campbell, a big-city businessman who visits his hometown where he jeopardizes a multi-million dollar business deal, gets carjacked and learns that his sister thinks their dad is a killer.
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
Allan Quatermain and the Temple of Skulls

link.synopsis: A team of young hockey players with little skill and a knack for losing gets a chance to salvage its miserable season under the guidance of the outrageous Hanson Brothers, Steve (Steve Carlson), Jeff (Jeff Carlson) and Jack (David Hanson). The third installment in the Slap Shot series, this action-packed sports comedy features Leslie Nielsen and all-star hockey players Mark Messier and Doug Gilmour.
link.title: synopsis
Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special

link.synopsis: Ripping a page from John Steinbeck's novel &NFi;Travels with Charley&NFi_;, this bittersweet comedy follows an old codger named Harry as he takes a cross-country trip with his cat, Tonto, as a companion. The film earned Carney a Best Actor Academy Award.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: The Ranger, the Cook, and a Hole in the Sky

link.synopsis: After witnessing a murder involving a corrupt cop (Rosie Perez) and a drug kingpin (Gary Cole), straitlaced pothead Dale Denton (Seth Rogen) must go on the run with his dealer (James Franco, in a Golden Globe-nominated role) to escape the wrath of vengeance-minded criminals. Acclaimed indie director David Gordon Green steers this stoner buddy comedy, penned by Rogen and his Superbad co-writer, Evan Goldberg.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day

link.synopsis: Mysteriously deposited in a perfectly serene but colorless city where every need is met, Andreas soon realizes that not even a new lover can change the sterile banality drowning him. Is this placid life a dream come true or an inescapable hell? Is the lovely music coming from a crack in the basement his ticket out? This provocative black comedy is directed by Jens Lien and stars Trond Fausa Aurvaag and Petronella Barker.
link.title: synopsis
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie
Dark Portals: The Chronicles of Vidocq
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives

link.synopsis: Two men go on an excursion to California wine country and end up inducing joint midlife crises in this critically acclaimed comedy-drama that won six Independent Spirit Awards, including Best Feature and Best Director. Pinot noir lover Miles (Paul Giamatti) convinces his soon-to-be-married friend Jack (Thomas Haden Church) to enjoy his last days of bachelorhood in style. But the pair end up choosing women (Sandra Oh and Virginia Madsen) over wine.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

link.title: Me and You and Everyone We Know
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Downsized into taking a job as a nighttime janitor, computer engineer Dory (Marshall Allman) and his fellow custodians become the unwitting subjects of an experiment that involves vision-inducing cookies. But -- as Dory and his pals soon discover -- hallucinations aren't the only thing the cookies spawn inside those who eat them. David Russo directs this trippy comedy that co-stars Natasha Lyonne, Tania Raymonde and Vince Vieluf.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
A Film with Me in It
All My Friends Are Funeral Singers
How to Get Ahead in Advertising
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Me and You and Everyone We Know

title.regular: The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
title.short: The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle

link.synopsis: Actor Peter Sherayko regales viewers in his riveting one-man show about one of the American West's most legendary characters: William F. Cody (aka "Buffalo Bill"). Sherayko brings the famed frontiersman, Army scout, Indian fighter and buffalo hunter vividly to life as he tells tales of Cody's bravery. Sherayko also recounts (in character) Cody's friendships with Texas Jack, "Wild Bill" Hickok and Sitting Bull in this historical tour de force.
link.title: synopsis
Karim Nagi: Rhythms of the Arab World: Vol. 2
American Masters: Willa Cather: The Road Is All
The Dick Cavett Show: Rock Icons
A Prairie Home Companion with Garrison Keillor
Rant: Who Says Words with My Mouth
I'm Doing the Right Thing with the Wrong Man
Jango Edwards: The Best of Jango
A Prairie Home Collection: Great Moments from the Original Radio Show
Broadway Theatre Archive: The First Breeze of Summer
Broadway Theatre Archive: The Rules of the Game
Broadway Theatre Archive: The School for Scandal

title.regular: Cody! An Evening with Buffalo Bill
title.short: Cody! An Evening with Buffalo Bill

link.synopsis: Veteran CIA agent Oakes (Anthony Hopkins) hooks up with street-smart bookie Hayes (Chris Rock), who's been asked to replace his murdered, Harvard-educated, twin brother spy on a top-secret mission. But Oakes has only nine days to train Hayes, and Hayes looks like a lost cause. This eye-popping action comedy from director Joel Schumacher and producer Jerry Bruckheimer co-stars Kerry Washington and Peter Stormare.
link.title: synopsis
Jane Doe: How to Fire Your Boss

link.synopsis: St. Albert's Hospital is one of the worst health care centers in the country, and six young interns are the only ones left on the sinking ship. As a result, there's a rash of unprofessional behavior, including a hot tub in the physiotherapy ward. Second City alumnus Dave Thomas writes, directs and stars in this hospital comedy, which includes generous gross-outs and general misconduct. Dan Aykroyd and Dave Foley co-star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: There are high times in low places in this dark comedy as three stoner friends hang out with a drug dealer who winds up killing himself. The pals make a hazy judgment call to to bring the body to the desert -- and wind up with a suitcase of cash.
link.title: synopsis
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: A pair of small-time hoodlums (Christopher Lloyd and Michael Jeter) kidnap the son of a town scion, thinking it'll be easy ransom money. But when the rambunctious 9-year-old (Haley Joel Osment) turns out to have an imagination the size of Texas, the guys are soon begging the parents to take him back. Mom and Pop agree -- but only for a price. This made-for-television comedy is based on the classic O. Henry short story of the same name.
link.title: synopsis
The Shakiest Gun in the West
When Zachary Beaver Came to Town
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs

link.synopsis: In this sequel to the hit comedy, Ben Stiller returns as hapless museum night watchman Larry Daley, who must help his living, breathing exhibit friends out of a pickle now that they've been transferred to the archives at the Smithsonian Institution. Larry's (mis)adventures this time include close encounters with Amelia Earhart (Amy Adams), Abe Lincoln (Hank Azaria) and Ivan the Terrible (Christopher Guest). Owen Wilson and Robin Williams co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Ice Age: Dawn of the Dinosaurs
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

title.regular: Night at the Museum 2: Battle of the Smithsonian

link.synopsis: This fantasy comedy stars J. Andrew Keitch as a gay man who returns to high school and learns that being part of the in crowd isn't all it's cracked up to be. At 40, single Brad Jenkins (Keitch) feels like a loser -- till he's magically transported back to high school, where nearly all the students are now homosexual. Brad dates the hot jock (Tim Hammer), but everything changes when Brad's best pal (Joan Lauckner) arrives on the scene.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Brennan Huff (Will Ferrell) and Dale Doback (John C. Reilly) might be grown men. But that doesn't stop them from living at home and turning into jealous, competitive stepbrothers when their single parents (Mary Steenburgen and Richard Jenkins) marry in this Judd Apatow-produced comedy. Brennan's constant competition with Dale strains his mom's marriage to Dale's dad, leaving everyone to wonder whether they'll ever see eye to eye.

Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story

Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay

I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd

link.synopsis: Young restaurant owner Zinos (Adam Bousdoukos) decides to revamp Soul Kitchen, his dumpy diner, but the customer response isn't what he was hoping for. To make matters worse, his girlfriend (Anna Bederke) flies off to Shanghai, and the tax collector comes knocking. But with the help of an inspired new chef (Birol Ünel), Zinos still has a chance at redemption. German director Fatih Akin delivers a riotous modern romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
